guide.introduction:
Unleash your meeting space! Throw away the schedule! Stop holding meetings that grow to fit the time allotted!

This project transforms an existing meeting space into an open, private (but shared) area that empowers the community drive the length of their meetings. Here's how it works:

Change the rules of the meeting room so that its open, available and unscheduled, preferably next to a co-working space. When a meeting begins, this timer displays 45 minutes on a large numeric LED display, made entirely with open sourced hardware and software.

As the meeting progresses, the time ticks down, giving constant feedback on how long everyone has philosophized and raised their blood pressure in this private (but shared) room. In this way meeting goers are encouraged to use the room for only as long as they really need it.

If more time is REALLY needed, a snooze bar is available to the meeting participants. However, if someone else is waiting for the room, this feature is not available.

When time is up, it's up! The users must vacate the room and use an adjoining open collaborative area to complete their business (which is more fun and relaxing anyway) and let others use the room… for no more than 45 minutes.
